title: Recursion
subject: Data Structures
theory: Recursion is when a function calls itself. It needs a **Base Case** to stop. Each call adds a frame to the Call Stack. Useful for tree/graph traversals.

examples.explanation: Unwinds when base case is hit.

common_mistakes.correction: Leads to Infinite Recursion and Stack Overflow error.

interview_questions.question: What happens if recursion is too deep?
interview_questions.answer: Stack Overflow Exception. Memory for stack frames runs out.

summary: Recursion simplifies code for complex logical structures.
